page.title: 14ECOLOGY IN CURY/GUNWALLOE
page.content: The area is subjected to the prevailing South Westerly salty winds which blow straight in from the English Channel. It is somewhat sheltered by the Lands End Peninsula on the oppposite side of Mounts Bay. These winds affect tree growth and though there are small sheltered plantations and valleys containing trees and other foliage, the area is as a consequence, mainly grassland. The climate is relatively mild with only small changes in seasonal temperatures.These range from approx. 2 deg C in Winter to 22 deg C in Summer. The surrounding seas with the North Atlantic Drift effect bringing warm currents also have an effect on temp. Passing through the area is the Coastal Footpath with its outstanding and changing views. There are several interesting circuit walks in the area.
